plugin.description:
The remote Redhat Enterprise Linux 7 host has packages installed that are affected by a vulnerability as referenced in the RHSA-2020:2485 advisory.

  - gettext: double free in default_add_message in read-catalog.c (CVE-2018-18751)

Note that Nessus has not tested for this issue but has instead relied only on the application's self-reported version number.
plugin.name: RHEL 7 : gettext (RHSA-2020:2485)
plugin.synopsis: The remote Red Hat host is missing a security update.

event.original: {"id":"55907","name":"HP iNode Management Center Buffer Overflow (HPSB3C02687) (remote check)","description":"The remote host is running an instance of HP iNode Management Center that is affected by a remote buffer overflow vulnerability. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can send a specially crafted packet that could result in a stack-based buffer overflow. A successful attack will allow the attacker to run arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges.","type":"active","copyright":"This script is Copyright (C) 2011-2021 and is owned by Tenable, Inc. or an Affiliate plugin.copyright: This script is Copyright (C) 2011-2021 and is owned by Tenable, Inc. or an Affiliate thereof.
plugin.description: The remote host is running an instance of HP iNode Management Center that is affected by a remote buffer overflow vulnerability. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can send a specially crafted packet that could result in a stack-based buffer overflow. A successful attack will allow the attacker to run arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges.
plugin.name: HP iNode Management Center Buffer Overflow (HPSB3C02687) (remote check)
plugin.solution: Upgrade to iNode Management Center 5.00.0103, which is distributed with UAM 5.0 SP1 E0101P03 and EAD 5.0 SP1 E0101P03.
plugin.synopsis: The HP iNode Management Center running on the remote host is susceptible to a buffer overflow attack.

event.original: {"id":"10585","name":"Microsoft IIS Frontpage Server Extensions (FPSE) Malformed Form DoS","description":"Microsoft IIS, running Frontpage extensions, is vulnerable to a remote denial of service attack usually called the 'malformed web submission' vulnerability.  An attacker, exploiting this vulnerability, will be able to render the service unusable.\n\nIf this machine serves a business-critical function, there could be an impact to the plugin.copyright: This script is Copyright (C) 2003-2020 John Lampe
plugin.description:
Microsoft IIS, running Frontpage extensions, is vulnerable to a remote denial of service attack usually called the 'malformed web submission' vulnerability.  An attacker, exploiting this vulnerability, will be able to render the service unusable.

If this machine serves a business-critical function, there could be an impact to the business.
plugin.name: Microsoft IIS Frontpage Server Extensions (FPSE) Malformed Form DoS
plugin.solution: Microsoft has released a set of patches for IIS 4.0 and 5.0.
plugin.synopsis: The remote web server is vulnerable to a denial of service
